title: Apple Inc. stock rises Monday, still underperforms market
text:
Shares of Apple Inc. 
        AAPL,
        -1.06%
       inched 0.64% higher to $173.72 Monday, on what proved to be an all-around favorable trading session for the stock market, with the NASDAQ Composite Index 
        COMP,
        -0.12%
       rising 0.82% to 16,103.45 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average 
        DJIA,
        +0.12%
       rising 0.20% to 38,790.43. Apple Inc. closed $25.90 short of its 52-week high ($199.62), which the company achieved on December 14th. The stock demonstrated a mixed performance when compared to some of its competitors Monday, as Microsoft Corp. 
        MSFT,
        -0.17%
       rose 0.22% to $417.32, Alphabet Inc. Cl C 
        GOOG,
        +0.21%
       rose 4.44% to $148.48, and Alphabet Inc. Cl A 
        GOOGL,
        +0.04%
       rose 4.60% to $147.68. Trading volume (75.0 M) eclipsed its 50-day average volume of 60.8 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights, an automation technology provider, using data from Dow Jones and FactSet.  See our market data terms of use. Something unusual happened in the stock market this quarter: Both the S&P 500 and Cboe Volatility Index, better known as the Vix, rose.
